desc: Can you make an animated music video for a song my band is wanting to release? The song is 4 minutes and 22 seconds long. I was thinking if I send you pictures of each band member, they could be animated and send the song lyrics to create the scenes?There are 4 band members. I attaching the song and the lyrics are below.Wild ManYou've been sneakin around these parts, in places you don't belonggetting sticky fingers, staring eyes, not thinkin about right or wrong.Cause your up to no good, wouldn't change if you could, boy your not as bad as you think.You better start developing a game plan son, cause I am on you before you can blinkThings just got physical, with a Wild ManYou never know what in the hell is going down, with a Wild ManSome people are driven, like this Mad ManOutlaw, insane, crazy, mad can't make up, what a wild man canShe's rockin the boots with the dress, country, sassy, sexyShe's lookin to impress all the boys down in DixieStaring me down face to face, I'm stalking my preyKissin, whisperin, dancin makes me wanna come out and playThings just got physical, with a Wild ManYour about to lay down, with this Wild ManNever been treated this way, in your life spanOutlaw, insane, crazy, mad can't make up, what a wild man canGot the pedal to the floor and the dust in the windSecond place right beside me, that boy he's tryin to contendIf he lets off that gas in this next turnDust, wind, and rubber he will feel my burnThings just got physical, with a Wild ManYour beatin and banging, with this Wild ManFlying right past you, like SupermanOutlaw, insane, crazy, mad can't make up,Outlaw, insane, crazy, mad can't make up, what a wild man canYou're dealin with a Wild Man(Just for reference, the first verse is describing a young punk who likes to steal things and is about to get an attitude adjustment by the "Wild Man". The second verse is describing a good looking country girl, who is about to have relations with the "Wild Man". The third verse is describing the "Wild Man" as a race car driver winning the race with a close second place guy making contact with each other's car.)I tried attaching the song below but they said the file sizer was too big. I can email it and I can also send you pics of the band and I can send some vids of our live show for reference. I would like to see the band performing in some of the scenes but not the entire time. It would also be cool to recreate these scenes in some way as well. Thanks.

desc: This project requires full working knowledge and expertise in Reallusion iClone 6 & 7 animation software suite, e.g. iClone 7 pro, 3DXchange, Character Creator, CrazyTalk 8.(I can provide the software and development platform and rendering engine for use on this project if necessary, and this can be done remotely.)I have several sets of audio that were text-to-speech converted from transcripts of several hearings from a court case.I want to turn these audio files into a set of 3D animation reenactments of the hearings, using the audio as the script and template for the animations.It is relatively straightforward animation, with 6 to 8 interactive actors/avatars in a courtroom at a time, e.g. attorneys questioning witnesses, judge addressing the courtroom, some establishing courtroom shots, witnesses entering courtroom, sitting down, walking to witness stand, picking up papers and exhibits, handing things to other characters, drinking water, writing on paper, etc.I can provide finished Character Creator avatars for the characters, and I have the courtroom project file setup; there is also a brief animation script for notable events, but most of the staging and actions is standard.Each hearing has a duration of 15 minutes to 2 hours.I do have the avatars, existing stage/project and audio for this project ready to go. These are things that the animators would not have to create from scratch.I am willing to pay $100.00 per finished hour of an animation project, each animation project representing a day's hearing, and completed in sequence to the chronology of hearings, and there are 25 separate hearings.
title: Courtroom Hearing Re-enactments 3D Animation

desc: This is a mobile application and it  is designed to share the status of specific location (restaurant, coffee, university, etc.) between one to one user through short conversation. Ex: assume an user staying in his home and he is planning to go to specific restaurant but he does not know if that restaurant is crowded or not. So, he will access this application as offsite user (two kinds of users, onsite user, where the user is inside the location and offsite user, the user who accessing the application outside the location. ), then he will send a message saying what he wants to all users inside that location. Then one of the user inside that location will reply to help offsite user and conversation box will opened between them to get exactly what offsite user wants with limited conversation.The design should include the followingThe design should include the following1. Logo of the application2. each page should be redesigned.2. the design should not be complicated.3. Proof reading for the language.4. Include animation as need, especially for  three introduction page.5. Any sketch, logo , picture should be avoiding the copy past (new design).6. reshaping any field.7. minimize number color.8. Beautiful background, photography, others optimize the use of bold colors, typography, extra-large icons and white space to make an impression with visitors.check the attachment and more details will be discussed later.Thank you
title: Designing landing page mobile application

desc: FFmpeg Mass video editing:I want to automate the preparation of videos with print screens and pre-recorded audio filesBased on a spreadsheet file.This spreadsheet will fulfill with CSV file with a report.If the report says, Problem X is positive. It will trigger the link for the explanation of Problem X.The FFMPEG should get this link for the audio of explanation of Problem X and assemble with a picture of a print screen related to Problem X.That process can be repeated many times based on the report in CSV file that will fulfill the spreadsheet.At the end of this process of putting together the relevant audio with relevant pictures in a video format. It all should edit in a larger video assembled in the order suggested by the spreadsheet file output.The video format should be optimized and ready for fast youtube upload without compromising readability and audibility.That process needs to be repeatable and scalable, only depending on the correct inputs and outputs of the spreadsheet file and the deliverability of the right images and audio files and correct naming.
title: Hire FFMpeg developer

desc: Looking for a filmmaker who has experience with Amazon Video Shorts for promote a product.Product is men's fashion fun socks. Must be creative. Here is the info for Amazon guidelines below:Types of videos you can upload:AdvertisementsHow To/ Product DemonstrationsUnboxing VideosProduct ComparisonDIYVlogWhat does Amazon Video Shorts require for submission?Video submissions do need to follow all of Amazon guidelines in order to be approved. Your video can appear on related ASINs, but cannot be featured on a competitor’s ASIN.High-Quality Video: We follow Amazon’s video quality requirements and reserve the right to deny videos that do not have proper content, sound, or resolution.Amazon Requirements: Your video cannot contain a product review for your Amazon ASIN, web addresses to sites other than Amazon, inappropriate content, mention of limited time offers, or mention of price discounts. Videos should only be linked to relevant ASINs on your seller account.Correct Video File Format: Accepted formats are: 3GP, AAC, AVI, FLV, MOV, MP4, and MPEG-2.Thumbnail Image: A 16:9 aspect ratio and a suggested minimum width of 1920px. Formats accepted are JPEG and PNG.Metadata: Video title (100 character max), Video synopsis (400 character max), Video Type, related ASINs
title: I would like to hire a Filmmaker
